news.title: New York Fed President Williams sees room for 'further adjustment' to rates
news.summary: Williams said he expects the central bank can lower its key  rate from here. He said labor market weakness poses a bigger threat than inflation.

news.title: Amazon cut thousands of engineers in its record layoffs, despite saying it needs to innovate faster
news.summary: Nearly 40% of the roughly 4,700 positions Amazon eliminated across Washington, New York, New Jersey and California were engineering jobs. The company eliminated the jobs in Washington, N.Y. and New Jersey.

news.title: Google must double AI compute every 6 months to meet demand, AI infrastructure boss tells employees
news.summary: Google's head of AI infrastructure said the company has to race to build out compute capacity. At a recent all-hands meeting, Google's chief of AI Infrastructure said the firm was racing to get ahead of the competition.

news.title: Oil prices and energy stocks fall sharply on Trump’s new Ukraine peace plan
news.summary: Oil prices and energy stocks fell sharply on Friday morning. The U.S. pushed for a Russia-Ukraine peace deal. The deal is expected to be reached in the coming days.

news.title: Gap comparable sales surge after viral 'Milkshake' denim ad with Katseye
news.summary: Gap, which owns Banana Republic, Old Navy, Athleta and its namesake banner, saw comparable sales rise 5% during the quarter.

news.title: China controls this key resource AI needs — threatening stocks and the U.S. economy
news.summary: The U.S. relies on rare-earth elements to grow its infrastructure. AI relies on technology to grow GDP. AI can also be used to improve the quality of life.

news.title: As AI angst hits markets, this stock — not Nvidia — is the canary in the coal mine
news.summary: There’s a way to keep an eye on how the market is valuing OpenAI, according to Citi. OpenAI is an artificial intelligence company.

news.title: Liz Truss redux? Simultaneous drop for Japanese currency and bonds draws eerie parallels
news.summary: New Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi differs from Truss in that she wants to spend rather than cut taxes. But both plans amount to aggressive fiscal stimulus, says Deutsche Bank.

news.title: BJ’s Wholesale’s keeps beating profit views and the stock rises, even as sales growth disappoints
news.summary: BJ's Wholesale's stock gains after profit beat expectations. Full-year outlook was raised again, to offset disappointing growth in a key sales metric.

news.title: Bitcoin falls below $82,000 as selling isn’t letting up. Here’s why stock-market investors are keeping close watch.
news.summary: Some say the selling, which could drag stocks with it, has more to go. Bitcoin prices were pushing into fresh April lows on Friday.
